headline: J.D. Vance Endorsed By Guy He Said Might Be 'America's Hitler'
author: Susie Madrak
sentences: "But then that of course was followed almost inevitably by a former roommate of Mr. Vance, sharing his text messages from 2016 in which Mr. Vance reportedly told people how he thought there was a pretty good chance that Donald Trump was going to be, quote, 'America's Hitler'.

That endorsement from Trump was followed immediately, in no surprise, by Mr. Vance launching a huge TV ad campaign touting the Trump endorsement -- bragging about how much he agrees with Trump, how close he is to Trump, how much Trump likes him.
"I mean, we just saw the de facto leader of the Republican party, former president Donald Trump, give one of his coveted endorsements to a candidate named J.D.
But even just a few years ago, today's politics headlines would've been rejected out of hand that is completely unimaginable and over the top," she said.
"In politics today, we've got another one of those days that feels, I guess, sort of normal to us now.
Rachel Maddow talked about how we've accepted some things as normal that used to be unthinkable.
"I'm not saying Trump was trying to be America's Hitler, or aspired to be, that's what J.D.
Vance, who is running for the United States Senate seat in Ohio this year.
All that remains is for the opportunistic and nakedly ambitious J.D.
Vance to decide which member of the Third Reich he aspires to be.
Vance said: 'This guy really might be America's Hitler.'
Hey, but that was before Trump endorsed him!
